title: platinumsteel2016
author: platinumsteel2016
content: GreetingsFirst off, I am in United States...Does anyone know of any Bitcoin Debit Card similar to Bitpay and Cash APP. That also allow at least acouple thousand withdrawal limit???  I am not interested in Coinbase.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Some exchanges right now are offering suchs a service but I don't know if your country is supported.I'll mention a few of them below- Bitget card = https://www.bitget.com/cards/landing- Bybit card = https://www.bybit.com/cards- Kucoin card or kucard = https://www.kucoin.com/kucard

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: @platinumsteel2016, there are topics on the forum where you can find out a lot of information about such cards, and maybe ask a question there and get a quick and better answer. It seems to me that there is a good selection of such cards when it comes to the US.BitList.co - Mixers ' Exchanges ' Services ' Casinos [V2] Big List of Crypto Debit Cards

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on September 15, 2024, 10:28:18 AM[V2] Big List of Crypto Debit CardsWow, NotATether is maintaining such a big list of Crypto Debit Cards, didn't knew this existed. Thanks for sharing. I see most of the cards are valid and working fine only for EU & EEA countries.More big exchanges and companies should be going forward to cater countries in Asia. That will help them grow much faster however I think the only issue is Govt restrictions with them.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: ImThour on September 15, 2024, 02:12:39 PMWow, NotATether is maintaining such a big list of Crypto Debit Cards, didn't knew this existed. Thanks for sharing. I see most of the cards are valid and working fine only for EU & EEA countries.More big exchanges and companies should be going forward to cater countries in Asia. That will help them grow much faster however I think the only issue is Govt restrictions with them.Even me, unaware that this list exists, by using the forum Google search will lead you to the older list created by Alani which was created in 2015 and updated in 2017.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on September 15, 2024, 09:22:50 PMEven me, unaware that this list exists, by using the forum Google search will lead you to the older list created by Alani which was created in 2015 and updated in 2017.As for bitcointalk threads, you'll get better results with https://ninjastic.space/search as well as better filters. OP may use the website as well if they're interested in checking individual threads or just posts made about a certain card which I recommend doing as part of due diligence.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I think the major ones being offered by large crypto companies are offered by Coinbase and Fold. They both have customizable options and offer things like cash back in Bitcoin on your purchases. I think both companies are large enough and established to the point where they can be trusted. I think that’s an important piece of the puzzle.

comments.author: COBRAS
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on September 16, 2024, 12:05:29 AMI think the major ones being offered by large crypto companies are offered by Coinbase and Fold. They both have customizable options and offer things like cash back in Bitcoin on your purchases. I think both companies are large enough and established to the point where they can be trusted. I think that’s an important piece of the puzzle. Agree, crypto scam from f owners coins payments/another services is popular scam theme. Trasted companys is more good for this. And if coinbase tall what they cant work with USA and anoter say what they work with USA, another company  may be scam.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: ImThour on September 15, 2024, 02:12:39 PMWow, NotATether is maintaining such a big list of Crypto Debit Cards, didn't knew this existed. Thanks for sharing. I see most of the cards are valid and working fine only for EU & EEA countries.~snip~Quote from: BitMaxz on September 15, 2024, 09:22:50 PMEven me, unaware that this list exists, by using the forum Google search will lead you to the older list created by Alani which was created in 2015 and updated in 2017.This means that you are not visiting that part of the forum, and there are all kinds of interesting things that are worth reading. Practically everyone who is looking for a way to "spend" crypto through a physical or virtual card can find something for themselves - and when it comes to virtual cards, even without KYC.
